body:
I saw the below failure in [Performance suite] should allow starting 30 pods per node.  Some requests with verb:PROXY took more than 10 seconds, and are causing the test to fail.

I think that proxy issues are a different test, right?  (maybe testMonitoringUsingHeapsterInfluxdb?) And that this taking > 10 seconds could be very reasonable, depending on what we're proxying.

There is this note in density.go:

```
    // TODO: We should reset metrics before the test. Currently previous tests influence latency metrics.
        highLatencyRequests, err := HighLatencyRequests(c, 10*time.Second, util.NewStringSet("events"))
```

If that is the case, sounds like we should either clear the metrics, or if that is hard, record them before we run our test and ignore the pre-existing ones.

---

```
...
[AfterEach] Density
  /go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/test/e2e/density.go:85
E0524 09:03:52.014844   19184 reflector.go:168] watch of *api.Event ended with: Stop requested
STEP: Cleaning up the replication controller
STEP: Deleting replication controller my-hostname-density60-2b8f45eb-0215-11e5-a561-00224d56fdcf in namespace e2e-tests-density-69a8a743-ad1c-4099-9fc1-2640a67e9aa4
STEP: Destroying namespace for this suite e2e-tests-density-69a8a743-ad1c-4099-9fc1-2640a67e9aa4
INFO: WARNING - requests with too high latency: {verb:PROXY resource:pods quantile:0.99 latency:30001065000}
INFO: WARNING - requests with too high latency: {verb:proxy resource:pods quantile:0.99 latency:30001057000}

• Failure in Spec Teardown (AfterEach) [69.514 seconds]
Density
/go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/test/e2e/density.go:166
  [Performance suite] should allow starting 30 pods per node [AfterEach]
  /go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/_output/dockerized/go/src/github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/kubernetes/test/e2e/density.go:164

  Expected
      <int>: 2
  not to be >
      <int>: 0
```

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Must be staffed and worked on either currently, or very soon, ideally in time for the next release.
labels.name: priority/important-soon

title: e2e flake (?) in "[Performance suite] should allow starting 30 pods per node."
